text: hello this is chef john from food wishes
comm with potato mustard green salad
that's right i love potato cells with
mustard dressings so i figured hey it's
got to be good with greens in there that
taste like mustard also so that's we're
gonna do this is very easy very healthy
except for the mayonnaise and very
unusual which is always a good thing
around grilling season cuz you get tired
of the same side dishes okay so here we
go we're going to start by peeling some
potatoes I'm using my favorite potato
salad potato the Yukon Gold so I'm going
to peel them cut those in half I got a
couple pounds this'll work would russet
I'm not a big fan of the red potato but
if you like it use that you are the boss
of your tuber selection as you saw we
added salt to the water always boil your
potatoes in salted water you know that
we're gonna put that on high heat we're
gonna bring that to a simmer and while
we're waiting I peeled some garlic I
like to boil some garlic right with the
potatoes and then I'll just add that
into the salad a very subtle yet
delicious garlic flavor and when that
comes up to a boil I'm gonna lower the
heat I'm just going to let that simmer
for about I don't know 20 to 25 minutes
until they're just barely tender do not
overcook these they should not be
falling apart they shouldn't be too firm
either but try not to let him get
waterlogged when they're done drain them
very very very well and let them cool
down to room temperature don't
refrigerate them just leave them out for
about a half-hour while we do the rest
of our prep so first up we're going to
do the dressing now of course the
classic dilemma is whether to go with a
mayonnaise-based dressing or an oil and
vinegar base I'm gonna do both here I'm
going to start with mayonnaise I'm going
to add some white wine vinegar to that
and a nice splash of olive oil I'm gonna
heat that up just a hair with some red
chilies you could use any hot substance
you want also going to sprinkle in a
little bit of salt and pepper final
seasoning is done at the end I know I'm
going to need some but don't put too
much just a little at this point get it
started and we'll just later alright so
once everything is in we're going to
whisk that together because of the
mayonnaise that's gonna emulsify very
easily so you don't need to be drizzling
in oil or anything like that just dump
it all in whisk it up and set it aside
now some people like to put pickle
relish in potato salads I like that once
in a while but sometimes it gets too
sweet so here I'm going to take some
Cornish owned which is just little baby
pickles French I believe
and I'm going to chop those up alright
just like that you could use dill
pickles or if you like things on the
sweet side use relish
so that's prepped and then it's on to
the star of the show mustard greens one
of the more beautiful greens we have at
our disposal and mustard green is not
the leaf of a mustard plant it's just a
regular green I believe broccoli cabbage
family if I'm not mistaken but it does
have a very strong mustard flavor if you
see like a stem or sometimes they call
that the rib that kind of Center spine
that goes up the leaves you could just
tear that out that's a little tough so
mostly we just want that thin curly leaf
part and these are very easy to chop
just kind of roll them up slice it like
that and give it a chop all right not
too fine not too big just do it perfect
all right and we're going to set that
aside and by the time you've made your
dressing and done your pickles and
chopped your mustard your potatoes
should be just about room temperature
which mine were I'm going to take those
potatoes and with a paring knife I'm
just going to cut chunks into a bowl of
course this is going to break up a
little more as we mix the dressing so
you don't need to go too small at this
point you can always make it smaller you
can't put it back together and by the
way that's how my grandmother cut
everything I never saw her use a cutting
board in my life she held everything in
one hand and cut it with the other so
that's for you Genevieve and once your
potatoes are all chunked up it's time to
assemble we're going to go ahead and
dump in the cornish own or pickles or
relish or whatever you use it I'm going
to dump in my chopped mustard greens I'm
going to drizzle in my dressing and
we're gonna give that a toss and we're
not going to do any tasting or adjusting
yet because this needs to sit in the
refrigerator for 1 hour to soak
everything up so that we can really tell
and adjust properly sometimes if you
taste salads right after you mix them
they just aren't going to taste like
they are when you serve them and then
you end up seasoning them incorrectly so
just cover it put it in the fridge for
an hour hour later pull it out unwrap
and then we'll make decisions first of
which do we need more mayonnaise do we
need another splash of vinegar and oil
all right mine's looking perfect but if
your seams dry don't be afraid to make a
little more dressing and throw it in not
a problem so we're going to take a fork
we're going to taste this and this is
where you're going to adjust your salt
and pepper all right my needed a little
bit so I'm gonna add a little bit
I'm going to give that a final mix go
ahead and throw that in a bowl I suggest
blue maybe garnish with a little more of
that mustard green it's a very pretty
color and texture but not too much
because it is a very intense taste it's
sharp
it's spicy it's bitter and because of
those attributes I think it's perfect in
a potato salad like this so this is
going to raise a few eyebrows but who
cares your job is to make the potato
salad not to worry about what happens to
people's eyebrows all right so let me
give this a try and as predicted it was
fantastic a little sharpness and crunch
from the pickles a little touch of

has like a horseradish sort of feel in
your mouth is my friend Ralph once said

an exaggeration it doesn't really burn
but it does have a very subtle heat
that's really really nice so I really
